verbs.description: [ARG0: CNN] [V: confirmed] [ARG1: that it was their reporter Jim Acosta who yelled questions at President Donald Trump and North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un at their momentous summit Monday . Here 's what Acosta did The pair came out of their one - on - one meeting and appeared at a balcony of a Singapore hotel before the media as they walked to the expanded bilateral meeting . One reporter was heard yelling , " Mr. President , how is the meeting going so far , sir ? " " Very good , " responded Trump . " Very very good . Excellent relationship . Thank you , thank you very much] . " " Mr. Kim will you give up your nuclear weapons , sir ? " the reporter shouted as they left . Acosta posted video of the exchange on his social media account . https://twitter.com/Acosta/status/1006372146904555521 Here 's a longer video of the interaction : Some saw Acosta 's behavior as another example of the attention - seeking that he 's been accused of by critics of the mainstream media . Trump supporter and Fox News guest Gina Loudon called him out . https://twitter.com/RealDrGina/status/1006358912747163648 Becket Adams …

One reporter was heard yelling , " Mr. President , how is the meeting going so far , sir ? " " Very good , " responded Trump . " Very very good . Excellent relationship . Thank you , thank you very much . " " Mr. Kim will you give up your nuclear weapons , sir ? " the reporter shouted as they left . Acosta posted video of the exchange on his social media account . https://twitter.com/Acosta/status/1006372146904555521 Here 's a longer video of the interaction : Some saw Acosta 's behavior as another example of the attention - seeking that he 's been accused of by critics of the mainstream media . Trump supporter and Fox News guest Gina Loudon called him out . https://twitter.com/RealDrGina/status/1006358912747163648 Becket Adams …
